intro: Dicliptera thlaspioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically forms dense mats of foliage. The plant has small, linear leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It is adapted to harsh environments, with deep root systems and reduced leaf surfaces to minimize water loss. Dicliptera thlaspioides plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native range.
